member_organisations:
Mersey Maritime Board Members include representatives from Liverpool John Moores University, Wirral Council, Bibby Ltd. Peel Ports, Cammel Laird Shipbuilders, ABP. 
 
Full details of member companies can be found at http://www.merseymaritime.co.uk/members-directory/
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
eu_initiatives: Mersey Maritimes main interests are maritime affairs including: shipping, maritime transport and logistics, ship repair construction, offshore energy, maritime finance and insurance. The organisation is active at UK national and regional level through the UK Chamber of Shipping.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Skills development and careers in the blue economy#E03399#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3399#Member#C
goals__remit: Mersey Maritime is a not for profit maritime cluster organisation which represents stakeholders from business, education, and local government in the Liverpool City region in shipping, ports and logistics, and offshore energy. Its direct membership is around 200 organisations.
relevant_communication: Mersey Maritime is active at UK national and regional level through the MaritimeUK.
